keyValue.description: Set of key-value options. They must be compliant with Java Properties
keyValue.label: Key-value options

sourceSetting.settingName: USGS Earthquake Events Accessor source settings

keyValue.description: Set of key-value options. They must be compliant with Java Properties
keyValue.label: Key-value options

customTaskSetting.description: A customizable, schedulable task which executes the code provided by an implementation of the 'Task' interface. If  enabled, it will be executed at harvesting end

taskOptions.description: A customizable set of options for the task. The content of these options, the way they are provided and parsed, are completely demanded to the specific task implementation
taskOptions.label: Custom task options

scheduling.description: When enabled, the default configuration of a scheduling is to run once and to start now

repeatInterval.description: The interval between the task ripetitions expressed according by the 'Repeat interval time unit' option. If the scheduler is set to run once, this option is ignored
repeatInterval.label: Repeat interval

startTime.description: Disable this option to start now (default)
startTime.label: Start time

repeatIntervalUnit.description: The time unit of the 'Repeat interval' option. If the scheduler is set to run once, this option is ignored
repeatIntervalUnit.label: Repeat interval time unit

endTime.description: If enabled, an eventual value of 'Repeat count' will be ignored and the scheduling will run indefinitely until this date according to the the 'Repeat interval' and the 'Repeat interval time unit' options
endTime.label: End time

repeatCount.description: Enable this option and select how many times to repeat the task, or leave it unset to run indefinitely. Disable this option to run once (default)
repeatCount.label: Repeat count

keyValue.description: Set of key-value options. They must be compliant with Java Properties
keyValue.label: Key-value options

augmenterPriority.description: Set the priority (lower value, higher priority) of the augmenter which defines the order by which all the augmenters are executed. Augmenters with same priority are executed with random order
augmenterPriority.label: Execution priority

volatileDatabaseConfiguration.description: This configuration is not editable and the underlyind database implementation is not persistent and it is supposed to be used only for test purpose

persistentScheduler.description: This scheduler stores jobs and triggers in a SQL database

slotsCount.label: Number of slots for scheduler tasks

volatileScheduler.description: This scheduler stores jobs and triggers in memory

userDateTime.label: The date time by which the user sets the scheduling

localCacheSetting.description: Cached repository implementation based on the local file system

description: This kind of repository is used to temporary store the results of the distributed queries. These records will be later retrieved if required for a 'get by id' request

cacheRetentionTime.label: How long (in hours) resources are kept in cache

databaseCacheSetting.description: Cached repository implementation based on a database

description: This kind of repository is used to permanently store the status of the asynchronous download

esPersistentSetting.description: Persistent repository implementation based on Elasticsearch

localFolderPath.description: If the given folder do not exists, an attempt to create it will be done. The given path must begin with 'file://'. Put 'file://user.temp' for the local temporary user folder
localFolderPath.label: Path to a folder in which to store resources

localPersistentSetting.description: Persistent repository implementation based on the local file system

nameOption.label: A name for this augmentation job

maxRecords.label: Maximum number of records to augment (0 = no limitation)

lessRecentOrdering.label: Elaborates before the less recent (according to the resource time stamp) records

sourcesOption.description: Leave unset to augment all the available sources
sourcesOption.label: Sources to augment

scheduling.description: When enabled, the default configuration of a scheduling is to run once and to start now

repeatInterval.description: The interval between the task ripetitions expressed according by the 'Repeat interval time unit' option. If the scheduler is set to run once, this option is ignored
repeatInterval.label: Repeat interval

startTime.label: Start time

repeatIntervalUnit.label: Repeat interval time unit

endTime.description: If enabled, an eventual value of 'Repeat count' will be ignored and the scheduling will run indefinitely until this date according to the the 'Repeat interval' and the 'Repeat interval time unit' options
endTime.label: End time

repeatCount.description: Enable this option and select how many times to repeat the task, or leave it unset to run indefinitely. Disable this option to run once (default)
repeatCount.label: Repeat count

timeBackOption.label: Elaborates only records created since the given amount of minutes. 0 to elaborates all records

s3DownloadSetting.description: Stores downloaded items to an Amazon S3 storage

s3StorageUri.description: Overrides the default endpoint to send requests to the specified AWS region
s3StorageUri.label: S3 endpoint

description: Downloaded items can be stored in the local file system (default) or with Amazon S3 storage

localFolderPath.description: If the given folder do not exists, an attempt to create it will be done. The given path must begin with 'file://'. Put 'file://user.temp' for the local temporary user folder
localFolderPath.label: Path to a folder in which to store resources

localDownloadSetting.description: Stores downloaded items in the local file system

testIsoCompliance.description: Per default this feature is disabled for all the sources.  Enable this option and add source identifiers to enable this feature for the given sources. Disable this option to disable the feature for all the sources (default). Single source identifier per row
testIsoCompliance.label: Test ISO compliance

description:
Set of options for the final phases of the harvesting process.
To enable/disable a feature for a specific source, enable the related option and add its identifier.
To enable/disable a feature for all the sources, enable/disable the related option

recoverTags.description: Per default this feature is disabled for all the sources.  Enable this option and add source identifiers to enable this feature for the given sources. Disable this option to disable the feature for all the sources (default). Single source identifier per row
recoverTags.label: Recover resource tags

smartStorage.description: Per default this feature is enabled for all the sources. Enable this option and add source identifiers to disable this feature for the given sources. Disable this option to enable the feature for all the sources (default). Single source identifier per row
smartStorage.label: Disable smart storage

markDeletedRecords.description: Per default this feature is disabled for all the sources.  Enable this option and add source identifiers to enable this feature for the given sources. Disable this option to disable the feature for all the sources (default). Single source identifier per row
markDeletedRecords.label: Mark deleted records

description:
Collections and datasets of priority sources maintain their original id during harvesting.
Select one or more sources to prioritize

enableMailHarvestingReport.description: System restart required. This feature also require that E-mail settings are correctly compiled
enableMailHarvestingReport.label: Send harvesting reports email

enableMailDownloadReport.description: System restart required. This feature also require that E-mail settings are correctly compiled
enableMailDownloadReport.label: Send download reports email

keyValue.description: Set of key-value options. They must be compliant with Java Properties
keyValue.label: Key-value options

emailSetting.description: Settings required by the DAB to send e-mail messages. E-mail are sent during harvesting(if the related option is enabled) and if errors occur during statistics storing (if statistics gathering is enabled)

emailRecipients.description: Comma separated list of e-mail recipients
emailRecipients.label: E-mail recipients

databaseStatistics.description: System restart required. Enable/disable statistics gathering and computing by means of an Elasticsearch database

enableMailAugmentationReport.description: System restart required. This feature also require that E-mail settings are correctly compiled
enableMailAugmentationReport.label: Send augmentation reports email

enableErrorLogsReport.description: System restart required. This feature also require that E-mail settings are correctly compiled
enableErrorLogsReport.label: Send error logs reports email (the related custom task must be enabled)

proxyEndpoint.description: The GI-proxy endpoint used by accessors and downloaders (e.g. to circumvent firewalls)
proxyEndpoint.label: Proxy endpoint

description: A customizable, schedulable task which executes the code provided by an implementation of the 'Task' interface

emailRecipients.description: The supplied recipients will be notified with an email when the task is done. The system email setting must be configured in order to send the email
emailRecipients.label: Comma separated list of email recipients

taskOptions.description: A customizable set of options for the task. The content of these options, the way they are provided and parsed, are completely demanded to the specific task implementation
taskOptions.label: Custom task options

scheduling.description: When enabled, the default configuration of a scheduling is to run once and to start now

repeatInterval.description: The interval between the task ripetitions expressed according by the 'Repeat interval time unit' option. If the scheduler is set to run once, this option is ignored
repeatInterval.label: Repeat interval

startTime.description: Disable this option to start now (default)
startTime.label: Start time

repeatIntervalUnit.description: The time unit of the 'Repeat interval' option. If the scheduler is set to run once, this option is ignored
repeatIntervalUnit.label: Repeat interval time unit

endTime.description: If enabled, an eventual value of 'Repeat count' will be ignored and the scheduling will run indefinitely until this date according to the the 'Repeat interval' and the 'Repeat interval time unit' options
endTime.label: End time

repeatCount.description: Enable this option and select how many times to repeat the task, or leave it unset to run indefinitely. Disable this option to run once (default)
repeatCount.label: Repeat count

defConcurrentMaxReqPerIPOption.label: Default concurrent max requests per IP

defMaxReqPerIPOption.label: Default overall max requests per IP
